main event: Witness sighted a bright orange light in the sky that disappeared going southwest.
interesting points: The witness watched the object for about 30 minutes until it disappeared.
The report states the object may have been a satellite or aircraft, as these were common in the area at the time.

A USAF meteorological reconnaissance aircraft crew observed a bright light moving rapidly across their field of view over the Pacific Ocean near Johnston Island. They estimated the light was approximately 20 miles distant and 20,000 feet above their aircraft, which was flying at 34,000 feet. They observed the light for approximately 30 seconds before it disappeared from view. The crew stated that the light appeared to be under intelligent control and they considered it unidentified.

The witness described the object as round, about 6 inches in diameter, with a silvery color and metallic sheen. It was approximately 150 feet away and 100 feet high, and moved in a straight line rapidly and silently.
The witness had no explanation for the strange sighting and described the object as moving in a manner they had never seen before.
sighted object: bright orange light, round silvery object, bright light
location: New York, New York; Pacific Ocean near Johnston Island
witnesses: observer, USAF meteorological reconnaissance aircraft crew
